description.value:
Trigger A PC approaches within 20 feet of the trap

Effect The rag-wrapped figure cries out in pain. The triggering PC must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). The trap then rolls initiative.

details.description: A loved one, tied to a post with thick ropes, suddenly lurches to life and begins to shriek in anguish as soon as one of the PCs comes within 20 feet.
details.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:31] (expert) to remove the small runes carved on the pole that focus the magic, or @Check[occultism|dc:28] (trained) to recognize the occult illusions woven into the trap and disable the underlying magic
details.reset: A cruel welcome trap resets at midnight.
details.routine:
(1 action; illusion, mental, occult, visual) The cruel welcome's head lifts, and it gazes at the closest PC within 20 feet; if there are no PCs in range, the trap does nothing, its turn ends, and it deactivates until midnight. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26|traits:illusion,mental,occult,visual] save.

Critical Success The PC is unaffected. For the next 24 hours, the PC gains a +4 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against cruel welcome traps.

Success The PC recognizes the face of the tormented figure on the pole as that of a loved one, and the anguish of the sight results in @Damage[4d10[mental]] damage. For the next 24 hours, the PC gains a +4 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against cruel welcome traps.

Failure As success, but @Damage[(4d10+22)[mental]] damage.

Critical Failure As failure, but @Damage[(8d10+44)[mental]] damage, and the PC becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours.
